The Elder Sakka’s Story
Seeing a forest with a stream,
peaceful, clear, and undisturbed,🔽like the one used by the seers,
an offering to the recipients.
Having made a shrine on the bank,
I scattered various flowers;
As if in the presence of the Buddha,
I worshipped the image.
Endowed with the seven treasures,
a king, a lord of the land,
Satisfied with my own deeds,
this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
For ninety-one eons,
the flowers I offered;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
For eighty eons my fame
was a wheel-turning monarch;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
a lord of the four continents.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations as well,
The six super knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha's instruction has been done.🔽Thus has it been told

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sakacintaniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sakacintaniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: that the elder Sakka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Sakacintaniyata is the first.
